result.execSummary:
The defendant Paris L Smith-Carr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 9/22/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

10:37 AM Defendant Paris L Smith-Carr in court, in custody.  Attorney Tracey J Lencioni in court for Paris L Smith-Carr.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 
Victim Rights Compliance

IMPOSED AND STAYED

COUNT #  1    
-serve 2 years in WSP, bifurcated into:
-initial confinement: 1 year
-extended supervision: 1 year
-cs to: 22CF117 but CC to 22CF75, 22CF90, 22CF94

Challenge Incarceration Program: Eligible
Substance Abuse Program: Eligible
